DOC.brief_title: Improving Health Low Income Women Following Birth Child
DOC.detailed_description: The postpartum period window opportunity promote behavior reduce risk chronic disease benefit reproductive health . The Expanded Food Nutrition Education Program ( EFNEP ) educational program deliver community-based paraprofessional 's aim improve dietary activity pattern among low income , multi-ethnic woman postpartum period . This study evaluate efficacy EFNEP impact diet activity pattern woman . Women recruit Special Supplemental Food Program Women , Infants , Children ( WIC ) randomize either EFNEP group usual care group . Women group receive standard WIC care consist nutrition-risk breastfeed educational message postpartum follow-up visit . Women EFNEP group participate additional two component intervention include five home visit motivational telephone call project staff . Primary study outcome assess Months 1 12 . Primary outcome include fruit vegetable intake , saturate fat intake , physical activity . Secondary outcome include Body Mass Index indicator fat mass distribution . The study also analyze mediate modify factor , include social support norm , perceive health status , smoking , television viewing , food insecurity , food activity access , utilization federal program health care .
DOC.criteria: Less 20 week postpartum Receive service USDA 's Special Supplemental Food Program Women , Infants , Children ( WIC ) Less 18 year age upon recruitment
